item.title: Projects
item.description: This is where my projects will be listed.

item.title: DIP
item.description: Changed my mind to make DIP instead of doing presentation during the Hack Day for workshops (which is still valid idea). This project is named after DevSecOps In A Pill, basically shell wrapper to include in development pipeline that for now has three basic functions: scan remote web target for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations look for vulnerable dependencies used in project (OWASP Dependency Check) search for sensitive exposed secrets in git repositories

item.title: DVNA
item.description: As a project for upcoming company’s internal hackday I chose to make workshops for secure coding in JavaScript, based on OWASP TOP 10 and Damn Vulnerable NodeJS Application. While I’m no coder by myself, I thought I might prepare as much I can from security perspective and use some feeback from more knowledgeable collegue in terms of code itself. The idea came when I stumbled upon “solution” book to DVNA itself from AppSeco.

item.title: Bookmarks
item.description: A collection of interesting links/repositories I found around web. exploit writing corelan tutorials linux (x86) exploit development series learning exploitation with offensive computer security 2.0 modern binary exploitation reverse engineering 101 stack buffer overflows: linux - chapter 1 smashing the stack for fun and profit courses and labs labs for the computer and network security class sans cyber aces pentest training hacking lab learn burp suite books the best security books to have in your library

item.title: About
item.description:
Name: Damian Age: 27 Job: DevOps Engineer Interests: Psychology DIY Cooking IT (Security, System Administration, Reverse Engineering, Networks) Accomplishments: Offensive Security Certified Professional CTF Winner @ x33fcon 2018
I treat people same way they treat me, most important thing in my life is to stay true to myself. I never give up, I do not tolerate half measures, I know what I do, what else do you want to know?
